View Javadoc

1   package ch.akuhn.matrix.eigenvalues;
2   
3   import java.util.Random;
4   
5   import ch.akuhn.matrix.Matrix;
6   import ch.akuhn.matrix.SparseMatrix;
7   import ch.akuhn.matrix.Vector;
8   
9   /**
10   * Compute the Singular Value Decomposition.
11   * 
12   * @author Adrian Kuhn
13   */
14  public class SingularValues {
15  
16  	/**
17  	 * Singular values
18  	 */
19  	public double[] value;
20  
21  	/**
22  	 * Left singular vectors
23  	 */
24  	public Vector[] vectorLeft;
25  
26  	/**
27  	 * Right singular vectors
28  	 */
29  	public Vector[] vectorRight;
30  
31  	Matrix A;
32  	private int nev;
33  
34  	/**
35  	 * Construct with the given matrix and required number of S.V.s
36  	 * 
37  	 * @param A
38  	 * @param nev
39  	 */
40  	public SingularValues(Matrix A, int nev) {
41  		this.A = A;
42  		this.nev = nev;
43  	}
44  
45  	/**
46  	 * Perform the decomposition
47  	 * 
48  	 * @return this
49  	 */
50  	public SingularValues decompose() {
51  		final Eigenvalues eigen = new FewEigenvalues(A.rowCount()) {
52  			@Override
53  			protected Vector callback(Vector v) {
54  				return A.mult(A.transposeMultiply(v));
55  			}
56  		}.greatest(nev).run();
57  
58  		nev = eigen.nev;
59  
60  		value = new double[nev];
61  		vectorLeft = eigen.vector;
62  		vectorRight = new Vector[nev];
63  		for (int i = 0; i < nev; i++) {
64  			value[i] = Math.sqrt(eigen.value[i]);
65  			vectorRight[i] = A.transposeMultiply(vectorLeft[i]);
66  			vectorRight[i].timesEquals(1.0 / vectorRight[i].norm());
67  		}
68  		return this;
69  	}
70  
71  	/**
72  	 * Sample main
73  	 * 
74  	 * @param args
75  	 *            ignored
76  	 */
77  	public static void main(String... args) {
78  		final SparseMatrix A = Matrix.sparse(400, 5000);
79  		final Random rand = new Random(1);
80  		for (int i = 0; i < A.rowCount(); i++) {
81  			for (int j = 0; j < A.columnCount(); j++) {
82  				if (rand.nextDouble() > 0.2)
83  					continue;
84  				A.put(i, j, rand.nextDouble() * 23);
85  			}
86  		}
87  
88  		final SingularValues singular = new SingularValues(A, 10).decompose();
89  		System.out.println(singular.value);
90  	}
91  }
